intro: Fleurya urticoides var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth fleurya, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, leafy stems and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate with a rough texture, and the plant thrives in moist, tropical environments. It is often found in shaded areas near rivers or in dense undergrowth.
